result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher Deon Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all mandatory costs, fees, surcharges and assessments.  To be paid by 2/17/2016.  Bail to apply. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.  Report in date Sunday, February 22, 2015 at 10:00 a.m.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. stats to apply for work of two jobs, if verified.
If defendant fails to report, sentence to be served straight time.  No release privileges.

Provide a DNA sample.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms; and that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher Deon Smith

Defendant Christopher Deon Smith in court with attorney Wendy Ann Patrickus.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 11 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 0 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work of TWO jobs, if verified.

REPORT IN DATE:  SUNDAY, FEBRUARY 22, 2015 AT 10:00 AM.
If defendant fails to report, defendant shall serve sentence STRAIGHT TIME, WITH NO RELEASE PRIVILEGES.

Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA, and pay all MANDATORY COURT costs, fees, surcharges, and assessments, by 2/17/2016.  Cash bail to apply.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.  

Received and filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgment;
Sentencing Referral Form.  aw
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Defendant Christopher Deon Smith in court.  Attorney Patrickus appeared by phone.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for sentencing.  Attorney Patrickus has a conflict and can not appear today.  Case adjourned for sentencing on 2/17/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court orders defendant to continue with Justice Point.  aw  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw
Information filed by the defendant for sentencing, received and filed.  aw

Defendant Christopher Deon Smith in court with attorney Wendy Ann Patrickus.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court makes additional findings to the denial of defendant's motion to suppress.  
Defendant wants to resolve the case.

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court also advises defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.
Case adjourned for sentencing on 1/7/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement, received and filed.  Court reminds defendant to continue with Justice Point.  aw
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Defendant Christopher Deon Smith in court with attorney Wendy Ann Patrickus.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court DENIES motion to suppress for reasons stated on the record.  Case adjourned for final pretrial on 10/16/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court orders all final pretrial documents filed by the next court date.  Defendant to go to Justice Point today after court.  aw  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Defendant Christopher Deon Smith in court.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for oral ruling and final pretrial.  Attorney Patrickus is unable to appear for reasons stated on the record.  Case adjourned for final pretrial and oral ruling on 10/13/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

14RM042694  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
09/05/2014

Court reinstates $250.00 cash bail previously forfeited.  Defendant MUST POST an additional $500.00 to be released.  Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for INTENSIVE Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  Court orders defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Christopher Deon Smith in court with attorney Wendy Ann Patrickus.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Motion hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  Milwaukee Police Officer, Stephanie Seitz.  State rests, subject to rebuttal.  Court held colloquy with defendant on his right to testify and right not to testify.  Defendant does not wish to testify.  Defense rests.  Evidentiary phase is complete.  Closing arguments made by state and defense.  Case adjourned for oral ruling and final pretrial on 10/10/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Parties to file all final pretrial documents by the next court date.  Court addresses violation report given previously 8/27/2014.  Defendant retest came back positive for THC, and missed his appointment with Justice Point.  Justice Point worker, Jazmynn M., in court now, and address the violations.  Court modifies bail.  Defendant taken into custody.  aw  Oral ruling scheduled for October 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Discharge Summary Report received and filed.  aw
Email from Justice Point worker, received and filed.  aw
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 500.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Christopher Deon Smith not in court.  Dennis P. Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
NO FILE IN COURT.
Defendant tested positive for THC on 8/12/2014, and had the sample retested.  Confirmation test came back positive for THC also.  Court contacted Justice Point worker to have defendant come back to address.  Defendant missed his office contact with Justice Point also.   Court issues warrant.  Next court date remains.  Clerk will contact attorney Patrickus and inform her of today's proceedings.  aw
State's response to the defendant's motion to suppress evidence, received and filed.  aw

Defendant Christopher Deon Smith in court.  Attorney Wendy Ann Patrickus appears by phone.  Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Antonella Aleman.

Defendant tested positive for THC.  Defendant wants to challenge test.  Court will modify bail, if tests comes back positive.  aw

Final pre-trial scheduled for September 4, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  Motion hearing scheduled for September 4, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for October 20, 2014 at 08:30 am.

14RM015516  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff: 03-19-2014

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.

  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Christopher Deon Smith in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Christopher Deon Smith in custody.  Joanne L. Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 28, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
